comments: Also: Numbers n whose binary expansion does not end 101.
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,0,0,0,0,1,-1).
formula: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7} mod 8.G.f.: x^2*(1+x+x^2+x^3+2*x^4+x^5+x^6) / ((x^6+x^5+x^4+x^3+x^2+x+1)*(x-1)^2). - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 25 2011a(n) = n+floor((n-6)/7). - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 02 2013
prog: (Haskell)a004776 n = a004776_list !! (n-1)a004776_list = filter ((/= 5) . (`mod` 8)) [0..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 17 2012(PARI) is(n)=n%8!=5 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 07 2013(PARI) A004776(n)=n+(n-6)\7  \\ - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 02 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
